availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Robinson (Washington County, Kentucky, soldier - 1st Lt. 11th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Uriah Robinson and Jane Robinson. Married to Ruth Prather Robinson in Washington County, Kentucky, on October 21, 1860. Father of Sleet P. Robinson. Attended school in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in 1850. Resident of Washington County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Washington County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant and first lieutenant from September 22, 1862, to July 23, 1864. Dishonorably dismissed from service on July 23, 1864.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0111.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film 000241383.
